result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Serena Josephine Thompson

records.addlTxt:
Asst. District Attorney Kari Hoffman appears on behalf of the State. Attorney Britteny Mae Koenig and Serena Josephine Thompson appear in custody via Zoom. Defendant was non-responsive when asked if she contests Dr. Speech's report. Present bond continued
Competency hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

Deputy District Attorney Caleb Saunders appears on behalf of the State via Zoom. Attorney Britteny Mae Koenig in court. Serena Josephine Thompson appears in custody via Zoom. Defendant believes she is competent. Court finds that the defendant is not competent but likely to regain competency. Court orders involuntary administration of medication. Present bond continued
Competency hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Competency hearing on June 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Assistant District Attorney Jessica Gereau appears on behalf of the State. . Defendant Serena Josephine Thompson appears via Zoom in custody.  Attorney Britteny Mae Koenig in court for Serena Josephine Thompson. Defendant objects to doctor's findings and requests neurologist to examine her. Court advises defendant that she must pay for another exam. Defendant also requests Atty. Koenig to withdraw and replaced with Atty. Brian Stevens. Court denies withdrawal unless Atty. Stevens agrees to represent defendant. Court denies bond motion. Present bond continued
Competency hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Competency hearing on June 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Bail/bond hearing on June 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Reduce Bond

Assistant District Attorney Aaron Linssen appears on behalf of the State. Attorney Britteny Mae Koenig in court. Defendant appears in custody via Zoom. Court finds probable cause and orders competency evaluation. ERT requests no contact lifted. State does not object. Court lifts no contact. Court denies ERT's request to increase bond.  Present bond continued  Competency hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.addlTxt:

Bond Addendum & Misdemeanor/Traffic Scheduling Order.
04:23 PM Defendant Serena Josephine Thompson in court with attorney Noah Kohl.  Defendant Serena Josephine Thompson in custody.  Asst. District Attorney John Luetscher appears on behalf of the State.
Defendant Serena Josephine Thompson not in court.  Assistant District Attorney J. Foss Davis appears on behalf of the State.  Competency hearing scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 10:30 am.
